content.content:
[]>narrator:This is not the first...
[]>torturer{torturer-emotion|neutral}:You damn wench. WHERE IS THE SEED?
[]>narrator:...And probably not the last... <ap> interrogation.
[]>narrator:Another kick lands square in your face.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|tortured2}:You drip more crimson on the floor.
[]>torturer:You bitch.
[]>narrator:He grabs your hair and throws you to the ground.
[]>torturer:We'll get our answers sooner or later.
[]>narrator:It seems your raspy gurgling still does not comprise a sufficient answer.
[]>narrator: And you don't intend for that to change any time soon.<lc>The painful echoes of months past would be for nothing if you caved in now, or ever.
[]>one:Hhhh....
[]>narrator:Heaving dryly, your form remains a motionless puddle on the untreated concrete floor. <mp>The rough texture has made short work of the skin on your knees, as has been its modus operandi for many interrogations now.<lc>The dried blood seeped into it has been the only form of organic hospitality you've ever known here.

[]>narrator: Within seconds of this lack of physical abuse, you find yourself lost in the bloodied blottings on the floor. <mp>A few breaths later, the pointed boot of your assailant makes its way back into your field of view. <lc>The clericant towers over you, like a panoptic guard tower. <mp>With a glance at his wrist-mounted timekeeper, he nudges the boot's steel tip against your stomach and draws out today's concluding words from behind the mask...

[]>torturer: ...Sooner or later...
[]>narrator: ...And leaves you to vegetate in a pool of your own blood.

content.meta.text: play_chapter_intro(anhedonia, Count Down From Zero, field, 0.4, prison)
content.name: play_chapter_intro

content.content:
[]>narrator:It has been an arduous trek out here. The dry summer heat has been taking its toll on your mental faculties, as has the absolute pain of using public transit out to a correctional facility beyond the city walls. <lc>Yet, it will all be worth it... <ap>today. <ap>Some time. <mp>Your girlfriend was supposed to be released before noon. <ap>The sun is well past its zenith now.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:It has been many months since you last saw her. Standing in the empty and wide-open driveway of the prison complex, you could only seek shelter from the burning sun overhead by the graces of one companion: <ap> A solitary tree that is still groaning under the weight of its death here.<lc> The field surrounding the concrete walls is parched and mostly dead during summer. <mp>Weeds donning the colors of ash and pottery adorn the endless expanse of earth here.<lc>Only the call of cicadas disturbs the air around you. <ap>Consistently so. <mp>These insects have been your sole fellowship for hours now.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:Ugh this shit SUCKS!
[]>narrator:You kick a rock into the arid landscape. <ap>The soil answers by dust cloud.
[]>anhedonia:...<lc>Fuck me.

[]>narrator:For the nth time now, you walk up to the gate- <ap>or the fireline rather.
[]>narrator:The guard shoots you another annoyed look, and you glare back in kind.
[]>narrator:And so you pan around to face your dead arboreal companion, and stride towards it again.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>narrator:Bending down to your backpack, you feel your face sag from the dust that has started to cake up your skin in combination with your sweat.
[]>anhedonia:Come on...
[]>narrator:You are on your last bottle. But the release ought be soon, so you take another gulp from the silicone vessel.<lc>You sit down against the tree, dried bark scraping against your skin. <mp>The afternoon stretches out before you, the entire day gone into the dust around you, and yet you remain here. Undeterred.

[]>narrator:And then, finally, after getting blasted by the late summer heat for almost an entire day, the main gate opens,<ap> and One stands there, duffel bag in hand, stature as broken as ever.<lc>You leave your backpack behind, run up to her, and just as she can react and drop her own bag, you're in each other's arms once again.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible,one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye0}:I missed you.
[]>narrator:Immediately your heart accelerates and a sorely-missed warmth wells up inside your core, up, up into your chest. You inhale her scent. <ap>As if she would vanish if you let go again, you hold One even tighter. <mp>She squeezes back. <lc>You nuzzle against her nose and she drives forward to entrap you in a sea-deep kiss. <lc>Indulgent in her touch for moments, you eventually pull away, and you find yourself lost in each other's eyes. This is happiness once more.
[]>one:I missed you too.
[]>narrator:You squeeze her tight. <mp>She squeezes back. <lc>You stay like this for a few seconds, until the guard barks a stern dismissal at you.
[]>anhedonia:Guard's a bitch...
[]>one:Let's just go.
[]>anhedonia:Yea...
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral,one+anhedonia-emotion|invisible}:And so, you make you way to what has transformed into your makeshift encampment for the day.
[]>anhedonia:May I carry your bag?
[]>one:It's fine.

[]>anhedonia:C'mon, you literally just got out of prison. Lemme treat you a bit.
[]>one:...<ap>Fine.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:You take her bag from her hands, careful to brush her hand, giving her a gleeful smile.
[]>one:You are such a cheesy motherfucker.
[]>anhedonia:Hehe... Can't help it after being reunited with my wife.
[]>narrator:You impart another kiss to your girlfriend who you like to call your wife.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Hehe...
[]>narrator:You quickly nuzzle against her, and then shoulder your own gear.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:So like- <ap> I don't wanna rush but the busses out here run like ass, so let's try and get back to the bus stop for now?
[]>one:Yeah, no worries.
[]>narrator:And so you sling One's backpack over your shoulder, and take her hand in your other one. <ap>You never take your eyes off of her. <mp>One more kiss, pulling her in. Tired but glad, One looks up at you. <mp>And then you depart.

[]>narrator:Hands never parting for even a second, you make your way back to the bus station you arrived at this morning. Under the sweltering late-summer and even-later-afternoon sun, the sweat pooling between yours and One's hand would make most girls uncomfortable, were it not for the fact that you two are - <ap>Factually<ap> - Gay as hell.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:Still gotta get used to... <ap> a ceiling that's not made of concrete again.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Yeah...<lc>I was gonna... Like...<lc>I'm not gonna ask you how your stay was?
[]>one:Mhm.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one:But yea. <ap>Bad. <ap>You know.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:But now I'm back with you!
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:I'm really glad too.
[]>narrator:Another kiss.
[]>narrator:Finally, after a few minutes of walking, you reach the bus stop. <mp>Standing there in silence, you do nothing but exchange glances and small squeezes of each other's palms. <mp>A kiss- <ap>Occasionally.
[]>anhedonia:So... When did you know you were gonna get released? And out of nowhere like that?
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:Not before you knew it... <ap>probably.
[]>anhedonia:I got the notice a few weeks ago.
[]>one:Then... No fucking idea, hehe. <mp>No time down there.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:Fuck. <mp>Messed up. Well, I'm glad you're out now.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Me too. Hehe.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Waiting for the bus the two of you make sure to hydrate with what little you have left carrying with you.
[]>narrator:After a few more minutes, your publicly-funded ride out of here finally appears.

[]>narrator:The bus ride home is barely one at all. Your eyes are fixated on each other the entire time. Legs pressing against each other, fingers interlocked and lips together more often than they are apart. Some perhaps too intense for public consumption. <lc>You don't care.
[]>one: I missed you soooo much!
[]>anhedonia: I missed you too.
[]>narrator: Like bathed in amber, One's eyes glow in a deep orange against the warm late summer sky. No words could ever capture the yearning both of you have endured all this time- But you don't need them to. With more gentle kisses, you gradually lean into each other more and more, tasting the other for all her delightful aromas.
[]>narrator: She is astral in her love.

[]>narrator: A bump in the road breaks up your affections, the city walls slowly starting to climb up in the distance.
[]>one: Say...
[]>one: I didn't expect you to be... This toned after all this time.
[]>anhedonia: I... Got into a bit of workout.
[]>one: Heh.. Bit... Try for byte.
[]>anhedonia: ...Bite?
[]>one: Byte. As in- <ap>Computers.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}: Oh my god.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: Hehe.
[]>one{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: ... <lc>So... What else have you been up to?
[]>one: Anything you didn't mention in your letters at least?
[]>anhedonia: Heh... Hacksaw practice.
[]>one: Been keeping up, huh?
[]>anhedonia: And improving. Can't use it outside of art and sex really, it's too artistic for that.
[]>anhedonia: But it's a good stress relief.
[]>one: Can't wait to see it.
[]>anhedonia: I'm sure you can't.
[]>one: ...
[]>one: Hehe...
[]>one: Yes! <lc>...<lc> Heh... I survived, fuckers.
[]>narrator:Self-sufficiently, One mutters to herself.
[]>anhedonia:I'm happy you did.
[]>one:Mhm.
[]>narrator:She lets her gaze wander outside, across the landscape. <mp>Across this dying, decrepit, hopeless landscape.
[]>one:...
[]>narrator:You glance at the bus display overhead, class-encased crystalline gasses flickering into shape.
[]>anhedonia: Should be there soon.
[]>narrator:You press into One for another kiss, like planting a banner on this vessel of decrepit public transit: We are fucking gay.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Despite your hormonal inclinations, you do not pounce on One immediately once you enter your shared apartment. <mp>The two of you are filthy- <ap>And not in the good way.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:Ugh.
[]>narrator:Dropping your bags in the hallway, you immediately try to restrict your movement as to not carry dust everywhere. <lc>One does not share the same concerns. <mp>Your girlfriend immediately takes strides into the kitchen- <ap>presumably scavenging for chilled beverages.<lc>You missed your wife.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:The almost clay-like residue that formed on your skin outside the prison walls is a sensory nuisance, so you make a quick pit stop in your bathroom to at least clean the roughest parts off. <mp>It takes a while to peel off, not wanting to turn it to sludge with water, but eventually you do not feel like a buried ruin anymore.

[]>narrator:You follow One's trail into the kitchen, your girlfriendwife noticeably eager to return to the comfort of the amenities of you own home. <lc>You find her curled up in front of the open fridge door, and lower yourself to kneel next to her embryonic form.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Cold... hehehehe.
[]>narrator:You gently nudge her nose.
[]>anhedonia:I- uhh- got some drinks for your return. <mp>They're in the fridge...
[]>narrator:With a quiet giggle, One drags her fingers across the bits of your leg in front of her.
[]>one:Thank you...
[]>narrator:You ruffle her head.

[]>narrator:After the both of you have gotten cleaned up, and secured drinks of choice - <ap>two times water on account of the pavement melting outside -<ap> you muster the courage to ask something that started plaguing your mind right after One's sentence began.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:I know we sent many letters over this... <mp>But I need to ask you in person too.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:...
[]>anhedonia:You're not upset at me?
[]>one:You kept the shrines safe, didn't you?
[]>anhedonia:...<lc>I did.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:Then everything is the way it should be.
[]>anhedonia:Doesn't mean you can't be angry at me.
[]>one:Am not.
[]>anhedonia:...<mp>I cost you two and a half years of your life.
[]>anhedonia:I...<ap> I didn't manage to protect you from the one thing I promised to protect you from.
[]>one:...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:I wasn't killed.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|crying}:...

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye0-crying,anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible}:Choking through tears, One suddenly collapses into your chest.
[]>one:...Don't...<ap>Don't let me be killed by them.
[]>anhedonia: I... <ap>Try...
[]>one:Can you promise?
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:Please.
[]>anhedonia:... <lc>I don't want to fail again...
[]>one:Then don't.
[]>anhedonia:... I promise. <mp>No death at the hands of the state.
[]>narrator:You hold her even tighter.

[]>one:Thank you...
[]>anhedonia:Always...
[]>one:Fuck... <mp>Didn't expect a breakdown on the first day...
[]>narrator:She lets out a chuckle.
[]>one:Fucking dramatic faggots.
[]>anhedonia:Heh...

[]>narrator:You spend the next few minutes caressing her form, assuring her that you are there- will be there- for her. <lc>One keeps breathing into your chest, hands clinging tightly to your top- <lc>And you wouldn't want her anywhere else in the world. <mp>You need to be an anchor more than anything right now. <ap>For her. <mp>The pride of having her trust gives your heart an additional layer of warmth.
[]>anhedonia:I got you... <mp>I'm not going anywhere.
[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye0}:One doesn't respond but you take that as a positive sign.

[]>narrator: Many more hours pass by, and eventually with the golden rays of the evening sun long gone, you find yourself situated underneath One as your blanket. Together in your bed again, you simply have been holding her close, showering her frail form in gentle kisses. 
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty,one-emotion|listening}:So... I've been wondering... <mp>Are our cycles still synced up?
[]>one: What kinda question! <mp>... <mp>Sad into horny is still real, isn't it?
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|smug}:You give an affirmative grunt.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:I think I'm about to have my period? <mp>But- <ap>Me feeling like crap is kinda universal right now.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:You gently caress her hand.
[]>anhedonia:I was just trying to make a cheesy segue, kinda.
[]>one:Why?
[]>anhedonia:No, it's too fucked. Too early for this.
[]>one:Horny?
[]>anhedonia:A little...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: Boobs sore... means ovulation is upon me.
[]>one:Uh huh.
[]>anhedonia: And being so close to you is... Making it difficult to think of much else....
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:Even after...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:Yea... Sorry.
[]>one:It's fine. <lc>I'm not feeling it.. Not yet.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:That's fine. <mp>No pressure of course.
[]>one:I know.
[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Intense emotions, huh...
[]>anhedonia:Yea.
[]>narrator{one-emotion|sad}:One nuzzles against your chest in affection, then looks up at you with eyes at the brink of tears.<lc>It is like this, where she exhaustedly opens a request.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:Say... The air is getting thick and we have a cloudless night. Could we go up to the hill?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Gladly.
[]>narrator:And so, with the sky dark overhead, you get ready for a little walk outside, enjoying One's first day of freedom together.

2.page_key: A Bus ride home from prison

content.content: []>narrator:The walk to the foot of the hill takes you out beyond the reaches of the urban developments, yet still within the city walls. <mp>It is here where light pollution starts to recede towards its cocoon of electro-chemical origins.

[]>one:I'm glad the hill still stands.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Bweheh... You're saying that as if the hill itself doesn't exist anymore.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Well, I don't know- <ap>Maybe someone dropped a nuke on it.
[]>anhedonia:Hehe...
[]>anhedonia:...<ap> Wait a second...
[]>narrator:You shoot her a knowing glance.
[]>narrator:She bleps her tongue back at you with a wink. <mp>Sighing wistfully, you smile back at One. <mp>You time a small sidestep so you can nudge against her as you walk.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:...<lc>Haven't been up here in so long...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Yeah...
[]>one:...<lc>The sky is so pretty.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:...
[]>narrator:Gazing at the sky in silence, you continue the trek up the footpath winding itself up this pine and gravel hill.  
[]>one:Does the bench up upon the hill still exist?
[]>anhedonia:Maybe. <ap>I'd hope so. 
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}:I'd definitely have noticed if some dropped a nuke on it.
[]>one:Oh shuddup.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Hehe.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:And truth be told, the wooden seating implement has did not become the target of WMDs, or other ordnance for that matter, since you last sat here - <ap>Alone - <ap>A few weeks ago. <ap>Maybe months? <mp>This became a place of mourning without One around.
[]>narrator:You sit down on the bench, thighs squished against one another, hands holding each other tightly.
[]>narrator:The horizon's spine is broken and bent and jagged, a single illuminated line separating the lightless wastes between the city and its walls- And the moonless sky overhead. <lc>These man-made lights are arrays of industry protruding skyward, surrounded by dead fields and arid soil. <mp>This desolation and the city at its heart reach far beyond the walls. The city is but a single spec, a short trip away from the coast, and the only mark of an established rule for most of its inhabitants.
[]>narrator:The clericants at the top of the food chain here show no mercy, positing themselves as prophets and speakers of a dawn that never comes. <mp>Sometimes, you dared dream of a world where you won't find yourself intubated by the whims of industriarchs. <mp>That hope- <ap>Has long faded.

[]>anhedonia:This fucking city... <ap>Are you happy to be back?
[]>narrator:One considers for a moment. Patiently like the stars shimmering brightly in the night sky, you await her answer.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:...
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:Only for you.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:...<lc>And, <ap>well, <ap>the godseed.

[]>anhedonia: How often have you thought about this?
[]>one: Hm?
[]>anhedonia: Your first day back... Out.
[]>narrator: One's grasp on your hand weakens.
[]>one: A bit. Like how we'd even be towards each other.
[]>anhedonia: Me too...
[]>one: Worried?
[]>narrator: You restrengthen your skinship, squeeze her hand even tighter.
[]>anhedonia: Not much. I know I won't really fall out of love with you.
[]>anhedonia: It's just been a while.
[]>one: Has been.
[]>anhedonia: ...I love you.
[]>one: I love you too.
[]>narrator: You exchange many more kisses in between.
[]>anhedonia: So... You're just gonna go back to work now?
[]>one: Can't wait forever. The rest of the world doesn't hesitate to deal with us either.

content.meta.text: play_chapter_intro(one, No More Inoculants, home_regular, 1.0, consume_the_body)
content.name: play_chapter_intro

content.content: []>narrator:You are home again. Reunited with your girlfriend, fresh out of the horrible clericant facility. <mp>Two and a half years ago you were incarcerated, and got yourself out by... means.<lc>Buried in your spine is your magnum opus, and a declaration of merciless revenge, the Godseed. <mp>Cultivated in the sunflower fields razed years ago, you hid it within yourself. <lc>Left unchecked, it could kill you within a single solar cycle. <mp>Inoculants make it not kill you by inhibiting its growth- Inoculants, which Anhedonia smuggled to you while you were away.

[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: Thank you for keeping me safe all this time. Stable.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}: Gladly.
[]>narrator{one-emotion|listening}: You let out an introspective sigh.
[]>narrator:That Godseed within you- it needs to grow for you to get your revenge.
[]>one: It feels so fast to go off inoculants already... <mp>Kinda?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Well, it's your call... <ap>Mostly.
[]>one:Mostly?
[]>anhedonia:My plug got hit and honestly I wouldn't know where else to get more.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:Oh...
[]>anhedonia:I can try and hit up randos but with regulations becoming more and more shit... That'll get us locked up and executed more than anything else.
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia:I'd do it for you but-
[]>one:It's fine.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:...<lc>That sounds like such a hassle.
[]>one:Had you been doing that? <ap>Until now?
[]>anhedonia:Sometimes.
[]>one:Damn.
[]>one:I mean...
[]>one: I also just can't really wait any longer, and they do make my head a bit floaty... Make the mind feel sticky. <mp>And so much other awfulness. <ap>Fuck.
[]>anhedonia: Well...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Does it feel rushed?
[]>one: No.
[]>anhedonia: Then...
[]>one:Yea...
[]>one:... You know my souls burns for something more. <lc>This body is made to be consumed.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...Yes.
[]>one: No more inoculants.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:We will burn these fuckers to the ground.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: YES! <lc> Yes we will!

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:So, how do we start?
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:I don't know yet. <lc>I think I wanna take the day off for now. Enjoy the world with you a bit.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:I'd like that.

[]>narrator: And true to your word, you did not lift a single finger yesterday. But as soon as you opened your eyes this morning, the world resumed its regular pulse. <lc>A pulse that led you here, to the edge of isolation. <mp>Watching the caustic skyline trace the barrier between earth and sky after you woke up reminded of you of where you are- <ap>where you were. <lc>You can never go back there.
[]>narrator:It was years ago when the clericants dragged you away from those sunflower fields. Maybe caught wind of your operation. <mp>Who the fuck is to say now?
[]>narrator:You fled with and to Anhedonia. <mp>There never was enough time to retalliate properly.

[]>narrator:Aggressive, grating, synthetic beats fill the air around your work. Your mouth tastes of sweet acid, traces from the treat you had mere minutes ago. Small and empty capsules of isotonic liquid dot the floor around your workspace. You'll get to cleaning those... Eventually.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia walks up behind you, water jug in hand.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Stay hydrated sunshine.
[]>narrator: She refills your water glass. In return, you briefly shoot her a gentle smile before you turn your gaze back towards the work at hand.
[]>one{anhedonia-emotion|happy,one-emotion|neutral}: Thank you.
[]>anhedonia: Woof woof.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Barely back from prison and already back to work?
[]>one:Can't stay idle forever.
[]>anhedonia: Sigh... <ap>So... What are you doing right now?
[]>one: ...<lc>Sketching out a sigil.
[]>narrator: Trying to find the ideal sign to beckon and guide the suncalling has been a grueling and extensive task- all morning. It is a shape that ought to serve as beacon for the sun to visit, for just a moment. <mp>Inscribed- <ap>In blood.

[]>one:We'll inscribe the shrines with them. <mp>We will... <ap>It'll be good. <mp>Gotta find a shape first.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:You can't work on this shit in prison.
[]>one:There's a few things that have been floating around in my head but most of them aren't concrete enough to be usable.
[]>anhedonia: So... I'll leave you to it? Let me know if I can give any creative input.
[]>one: Will do.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia lingers.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Don't overwork yourself already, hun, please.
[]>narrator: You have no real choice in the matter.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:You know I'm willing to tear myself apart over this.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:I know. I saw in the fields.
[]>one:We both did.
[]>anhedonia:We did.
[]>one:Thank you for it.<lc>We all need to shape our souls. <mp>This is such a grand work.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Anhedonia pats you on the head.
[]>anhedonia:You'll do well.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|pain}: You bolt awake to the sensation of your skin on fire. Painful blisters have begun to dot your skin, a sign of your body's transfiguration to come. <mp>The strings of time taut through the air above spell out the time: 8th gold, 1st earth. The time before time. The twilight of non-dusk. <mp>After over two years, this is almost a new sensation again. Clarity marks your mind. This is the 8912th solar cycle of your life. 
[]>narrator:Anhedonia's shell lies next to you, back turned, and her soul is screaming in square waves. She has always been loud inside.
[]>narrator:Fuck, this wisdom is hard to bear. And it is barely the beginning.
[]>narrator:With a searing pain trveling up your spine, arms, and torso, you lie awake. Multitudinous eternities pass, and your can see a side profile of you. <mp>Your own eyes are fixated towards the ceiling, staring holes into the air.

[]>narrator:Eventually, Anhedonia awakes.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sleepy}: Mgnnmngm....
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: ...

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: No, why should I be?
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:I'll be leaving you, eventually.
[]>anhedonia:I can bear that.
[]>one:And.. and I'll leave you lonely and abandoned... Like I was these last 2.5 cycles.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:Did you feel abandoned by me?
[]>one:No, I'm sorry... <ap>I... <ap>Loneliness just gets to you.
[]>anhedonia:I understand.

[]>one: I...
[]>one{one-emotion|crying}: Gods I don't even know if I missed you? I mean I did... I just...
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: You grow so numb.
[]>anhedonia: Don't worry. I'm just happy to have you back, now, in the moment.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: I missed you... <ap>So much. Enough for both of us, probably.
[]>one: My heart felt so empty.
[]>one: I was so alone... I'm... <mp>Still not used to other human contact.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}: No one else down there?
[]>one: None I'd describe as human.
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: You missed me a lot, huh?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: It was so difficult at times
[]>anhedonia: I missed you so much.
[]>one: Mhm.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}: ...<lc>You too? <mp>I just need to assurance too, I think.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: Sorry. <ap>Yea I did.
[]>one: It's been a while... <advance>Been a while... <lc>And you...
[]>one: I'm sorry for how raw and numb I've grown now.
[]>anhedonia: I won't fault you for it.
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia: Is it okay if I hold your hand?
[]>one: Do.

[]>narrator: Gently, with a hint of shyness, Anhedonia slips her hand under yours, fingers locked.
[]>narrator: This is the first time you've both cooled down now. The first time to properly assess your emotions and how you feel around the other now. <mp>Your stomach is wrought with an uncomfortable knot of uncertainty, when all you want is for you to be ecstatic about being back with Anhedonia.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: I feel so formless right now.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: We all grow hurt when isolated. <mp>It's...
[]>one: Yeah.
[]>anhedonia: I'm not... <ap>Hurt. Not directly. <mp>I'll gladly wait for you to warm up more, if you need it.
[]>anhedonia: It's horrible... Knowing you were getting crushed by that weight of loneliness.

[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: It's fine.
[]>one: Couldn't have done anything about it.

[]>narrator: When the next morning rolls around, you already feel a bit more at ease than yesterday. Anhedonia is peering over letters, presumably trying to find gigs as performance artist. <lc>Her performances are... Visceral. Beautifully violent and bloody displays of the limits of the human body- Drawn out at the serrated edge of her hacksaw.
[]>narrator: It stands there- Harmless. Propped up against the wall, clean and wrapped. <mp>A magnificent instrument only she could wield like this. It requires absolute certainty and relentlessness, and familiarity with the human body, the latter someone can only really get when they have access to a selfless vesselgirl such as yourself.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}: I'm trying to find something. Been ages since there's been outreach from any of the networks.
[]>narrator: Seems like you have been spotted daydreaming.
[]>one: Aw.
[]>one: I hope something turns up.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}: Heh. Same. <mp>Would love to use it again.
[]>narrator: With a deliberate blink, and her body visibly relaxing from the tense gig hunt, she puts down the pile of letters.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|listening}: Say, with the eyes now returning. <ap>This means the goseed has taken root again, right?
[]>one:Yep.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:I wanted to ask about that- like in general.
[]>anhedonia: Can I do anything for you, by the way? Help with the godseed?
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: I'm not sure actually...
[]>one: It just consumes my body... Slowly.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia: So keeping your body alive is the only thing I can do?
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: For the seed, yes.
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}: I need you more anyways though.
[]>anhedonia: ...What?
[]>one: Don't neglect your girlfriend now.
[]>anhedonia: Oh shit, yea. Of course.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: Good.
[]>one: Then take good care of this vessel!
[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:Well, and-
[]>anhedonia:What?
[]>one:But...
[]>one:You know...
[]>one:You can still do things to it...
[]>narrator:Anhedonia steals a glance at the weapon so artfully propped up in your living room.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:Do depraved and sadistic things to it?
[]>narrator:You blush at her forwardness, even if you have adopted a similarly open approach over the course of your relationship.
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}:Perhaps... <ap>Perhaps I just have regained this need for you to tie me up and destroy me...
[]>anhedonia: Then you'll be a good girl for me and give me everything you got.
[]>one:Mhm.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: You know how to cradle my soul.
[]>one:I need to give you everything.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:...
[]>one:Everything for you... <ap>and the godseed...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:...<lc>Then how about some destruction tomorrow?
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}:Please.

content.content:
[]>narrator{one-emotion|suspended1,anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:In an instant, you find yourself hoisted up by Anhedonia.
[]>narrator:All of your core muscles are stretched back, as if positioned to retreat from Anhedonia. Yet those same muscles are now completely exposed, your half-atrophied build on full display.
[]>narrator:Anhedonia lets out a giddy little giggle.
[]>anhedonia:You're so damn beautiful.
[]>narrator:Your arms have been tied back to the far reaches of the room- Not with a gentle hemp rope- But unrelenting and heavy steel. <mp>The warm shibari bindings around your torso just for show.
[]>narrator:Suspended by nothing but the binding violence of inhuman metal, you cling to everything that gives you life here. Anhedonia's presence, and every single dead fiber cell the ropes can offer to your warm, pulsating, living, flesh- <ap>Body.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|holding-hacksaw}:Idle scratches have already begun decorating your skin, owing to the strain needed to suspend you like this, accompanied by the errant rapping of Anhedonia's chained hacksaw across your skin.
[]>anhedonia:Let us build up, yes?
[]>anhedonia:Or perhaps this is too gentle for you?

[]>narrator:Whipped and flayed, dangling from the ceiling now, Anhedonia gazes up at you.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: ...Good.
[]>anhedonia:Gods, you're so pretty.
[]>one:Mhnhmm...
[]>one:...
[]>narrator:With heaving breaths you look down upon your partner. <mp> The distant glow of an unaddressed flame lingers in your eyes- <mp> And she sees it too.
[]>anhedonia:....

[]>anhedonia:So pretty and gorgeous and so beautifully to bleed. <mp>Good girl... <ap>Good...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|holding-hacksaw}:Now give me more.

[]>narrator:And then she reaches out again, ripping the hacksaw across your chest once again.. Your vision briefly fades into the space between stars before they collide in a violent copulation again.
[]>narrator{one-emotion|suspended2}:And then you snap back to Anhedonia.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|holding-hacksaw}:Hacksaw whip at her side, she coils the cold metal chain around your arm, then tightens the raw and skin-abrading bind.
[]>narrator:Your breathing accelerates.
[]>narrator:Your eyes never leave their fixations on each other.
[]>narrator:And then a sharp motion and the upper layers of your arm flesh are rent asunder, staining the floor below with the mangled and undefined viscera of your dermis.

[]>one:... Gods...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:...This is... <lc>I love you...<lc>This is... great.
[]>anhedonia:It is...., can you give more?
[]>one: I'd be dead if I couldn't.
[]>anhedonia: Good. 
[]>narrator: You demean your mime as far down as your facial muscles will carry, only to state the obvious and implicit question.
[]>one: Am I really not broken enough for this?
[]>anhedonia:You made it out and returned here. That is more than enough. <mp>You are...
[]>anhedonia: <call:zoom_to_str,1.3,0.5>Such a good vessel.
[]>anhedonia:Befit for your purpose. <mp>Befit for... <ap>me.
[]>narrator:Blood is running down your arm now, exposed nerve endings and sinew twitching in fright at the exposure to the unfamiliar environment of this toxic air you have to call your daily scourge.
[]>anhedonia:Such <call:zoom_to_str,1.0,2.5>a good vessel of divine machine flesh.
[]>narrator:You feel your organic processes churn and react; Convulse.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|suspended3}:You puke up blood now, too. With a disgusting squelch it hits the ground as your retch and recoil at the foul mixture of stomach acid and heama making its way up your throat.
[]>anhedonia: Good girl.
[]>narrator:The sweet affirmations send shivers down your spine, hacking directly into the primordial brainstem that has come to make you associate pain with pleasure more than anything else... <mp>You shiver again from the rush of endorphins, coupled with latent muscle spasms contorting your esophagus. 
[]>narrator:You feel like you ought to die, and you know you can't. Your are safe here, with Anhedonia.
[]>anhedonia: And you are mine.
[]>one:...Please...I am...
[]>anhedonia: So so good. Such a soft and cute girl you are.
[]>narrator:Two sensations: The taste of iron barreling across your mouth; And the cooing vocalizations of your girlfriend. <mp>Both are sugary sweet.
[]>one: Gods...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>anhedonia:Is it a lot?
[]>one:A bit...
[]>one:Please...
[]>one: Let me... Down...
[]>anhedonia:Only if you beg for it. <mp>Your horny brainfog got you into this mess, you can also let it carry you out of it.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:....
[]>one:...
[]>narrator:The acute physical trauma rendering it so so difficult to respond adequately to Anhedonias inquiries.
[]>one:...
[]>one:FUCK!
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:Fuck, you need her.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:..Down... Release... Please...
[]>narrator:You retch and shiver with each syllable.
[]>anhedonia:My my, you are so pathetic.
[]>one:Mnmfnm...
[]>narrator:You exhale.
[]>one{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:....Violently.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: Hehe. I knew. 
[]>one:...
[]>anhedonia:Filthy fucking masochist.
[]>narrator:Heavy and meant breaths exude from your lungs, carrying the stench of fresh blood with them.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|holding-hacksaw}:....With pleasure.
[]>narrator:And so Anhedonia grips the whip once again, and snaps it around your torso.

[]>narrator:Its long chain winds it way across your ribcage and neck, until having you in a tight and infinitely warm and homey embrace... The metal links dig into your pores at every twitch of your muscles.
[]>anhedonia:...You good?
[]>one:...
[]>narrator:You nod.
[]>narrator:Anhedonia nods back. She takes three steps back. Takes one forward, then sets the next foot down faster, takes another step forward, gathers motion forwards, and pummels shoulder first into your sternum. <mp>Chains mangle and eviscerate the blinded eyes and scarred skin above your waistline, <ap>and then with the weight of a black hole <ap>devouring another sun, Anhedonia embraces you, reaches above your head, cuts down all ties in one motion, <ap>and plummets with you down to the ground.

[]>narrator:Upon hitting your lover beneath and the ground beneath her cracking her spine in several. Places, the chains immediately lose tension and you feel nothing bit the warm flesh of your lover beneath to nuzzle into. And so you do.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy,one-emotion|joy}:.... Fuck yea.... This was so good.
[]>one: Yes.
[]>anhedonia: Are you safe? 
[]>one: I am. Thank you.
[]>anhedonia: I thank you.
[]>narrator:The skin already starting to scar and reform under the pressure of being a vessel divine incarnate, you lose yourself in the reassurance of a yearning desirer laying right there, beneath you.
[]>narrator:You can barely get the binding gear off the bed before dozing off to the realm of slumber together, a warm blanket of your very own blood coating you both.

[]>gods:Wake up.
[]>narrator:There is a flame blazing away in the distance between your pupils and consciousness. Emenating at the peak of that mountain, ir circles you, and builds a firewall of pure Purpose.

[]>one{one-emotion|invisible}:Hello, my beautiful sunflower child.
[]>gods:So... you have become our vessel?
[]>one:The garden had been seized. The greenhouse is gone. My flesh was all that remained.
[]>gods:Remains...

[]>narrator:amenra the pain it is shapeless
[]>one: you don't want the clericants to know about you
[]>gods: yiu think they don't?
[]>one: I do t know. but they either won't use u or let tou wither or don't know how to use u.
[]>one:that makes them cowards
[]>one:it doesn't matter if it kills me. I'll bring this place to me. down on top of the clericants and eradicate them.

13.page_key: O confrontation with one's inner world after suspension bdsm

content.content:
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Today it was Anhedonia who invited you for a small early morning date atop the hill. <mp>You managed to catch the sunrise from atop the hill for once, all snuggled up against one another.
[]>anhedonia:You can even see the ocean from up here today.
[]>one:Industry hasn't blotched it out yet today.
[]>one:...
[]>one:Pretty...

[]>narrator:You continue staring out at the scenery, peaceful clouds passing overhead.
[]>narrator:Over time, you lean more and more into Anhedonia's form.
[]>narrator: With enough time even, her hand finds itself between your legs, mere finger widths away from your crotch. You shoot her a glance.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: Hey.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:Anhedonia smiles back at you.
[]>anhedonia: Hi.
[]>narrator:Her hand finds your clit, gently resting one of her fingers atop. <ap>You take a deep breath.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:So mean... Teasing like that.
[]>anhedonia:Hehe.
[]>one:Cuddles... now. <lc>Maybe later.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:Okies.

[]>narrator:The world looks different up here, wrapped in your tunic. And with a clear sky and the forest's solitude feeding your senses, the godeyes calm down. The golden sun that has risen above the horizon line by now is by far the loudest input into your nervous system.
[]>anhedonia: How are you now?
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: Good. Calm...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Yeah.. You... Seem a bit less jittery?
[]>one: The eyes shut up for once. Must be this nature, this... Nothingness.
[]>anhedonia: I wouldn't call it nothing... There's trees and the sun and the air...
[]>one:...
[]>one: Mhm....
[]>anhedonia: But do you feel... Better?
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: Heh. <mp>Funny. <mp>Not at all. My skull feels empty. I... I need the chatter. It makes me whole.
[]>anhedonia: Maybe it's also just habit?
[]>one: Possibly. But as long as I can feast on it, and grow from it, I wanna keep it around. ...And then...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:... Sorry.
[]>anhedonia: It's fine. I know.

[]>narrator:When you return home, the reality of your work goals for today hit you back in your face.
[]>narrator:After you've both freshened yourself up, you dig back into your work, drawing out oxylithic gel into solid rock formations, and carving them into shrines as needed.
[]>narrator:And with the unrelenting rays of the sun piercing your many dead pupils, the smell of fresh hardened oxylith reminds you of past addiction.
[]>narrator:The monolithic gaze of the lowest point of your life staring back at you.
[]>narrator:You spend many of your "working" days in between worlds. <mp>Sometimes the work bench calls, driving you to shape new shrines, work the oxylithic gel to your whims. Occasionally, sometimes for hours at a time, you instead listen into the aether, and the news broadcast throughout.<lc>Being around so many mind-altering substances surely will have started to affect you by now.<lc>Today, your work calls you out, to a different part of the city.

[]>narrator: With the spatial arrangement of the shrines being as critical as it is, you take great care to scout out areas before you need to enter them. <mp>This time, you are going out to some of the- <ap>Ruins. <mp>Half-collapsed districts of deserted office buildings and industry, ousted by clericants when they rose to power.
[]>narrator: A wasteland, uninhabitable, and marred by the traces of dead hope. <mp>Colonialism within the city walls.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned,one-emotion|neutral}: And you're sure you don't want me to accompany you?
[]>one: It's less dangerous than it seems. The bombs stopped falling over a decade ago.
[]>one: Those that still live there are harmless.
[]>one: And... Don't want you to get hurt accidentally.
[]>anhedonia: Neither do I.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: I'll be careful. Know the place, scouted before.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia:Sigh...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}: Please stay safe. <mp>I love you.
[]>one: Will do. <mp>Love you too.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|neutral}: A mere minutes later you find yourself on a train out to the industrial smokestacks and catalyst arrays that dot the landscape in the distance.
[]>narrator:This is one of the heavier shrines, requiring all of your strength to carry. But endangering Anhedonia on these ventures is something you actively try to avoid, most effectively of all by just not taking her with you to begin with.
[]>narrator: Massive electrical pylons roll across the horizon, the driving motor for much of the chagrin the clericants cause.
[]>narrator:The train continues to roll through the landscape, isolated clusters of workers getting on and off at key nodes inside this maze of industry. <mp>Eventually, you reach your stop. A desolate station, denoting the place where once stood worker encampment that have since been abandoned. <lc>You hulk the circuit-breaker-sized rock formation down the train station steps, and then roll it the rest of the way. <mp>Using a bit of triangulation, you determined the ideal position for this anchoring shrine would be in one of the wiped admin buildings here.

[]>one: Mmrmhm...
[]>narrator: The summer heat and exertion of rolling this heavy stone weight through the rubble relentlessly hammer against your head.<lc>A short walk through this dead town takes you there eventually. <lc>Wading through needles and bandages on the ground, you finally set down the shrine next to one of the rebar pillars.

[]>narrator:Whatever adornments the capital buildings might boast, has been completely stripped away here: By time, war, and the ravenous drive for efficiency of industriarchs. <mp>Functional concrete, exposed piping, untreated chemical refuse.
[]>one: ... Time to get to work.
[]>narrator: You jam a blade into the shrine, then engage the canister trigger to infuse it with compounds to liquidize the oxygen bonds within. You make it leak it's own substance a few droplets at a time, fusing it with the ground.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|neutral}:You then extract the knife and slice it across your arm without hesitation. A fairly deep laceration, and yet just enough to draw out a sufficient amount of blood to inscribe your blessing upon the oxylith. Dripping blood over the shrine and cracked concrete floor, you make sure to leave no partition untouched. <mp>Every carved letter sends a ripple of blinks across your body. Godeyes glimpsing at the sunlight of futures snuffed out, of nevermore opportunity.
[]>narrator: And so you whisper a blessing upon the bloodied site, <ap>a 6 word requiem. <mp>You briefly reside at the self-devoted holy site to bandage yourself, taking in the stale and quiet atmosphere out here.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|anxious}: Your routine is disruped however, as when you pack up your tools, the air suddenly reverberates with a violent explosion in its wake.
[]>one: Oh fuck...
[]>narrator: As aftershocks travel through the air, dust crumbles from the ceiling, coating you in grey.
[]>one: ...
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: This is hell.
[]>narrator: It was not that uncommon that old detonators and safety mechanisms of undetonated explosives to go off out here.
[]>narrator: The bombing only stopped a decade ago, after all.
[]>narrator: Solemnly, you continue packing your stuff, trying not to think of the chances of this happening under your feet on your way back. <mp>You hope than none of the squatters out here got hurt.
[]>narrator: Gear quickly shouldered, you get going with renewed urgency. Time to return to Anhedonia posthaste.

14.page_key: O work: place shrines in industrial area

content.content:
[]>narrator:Day in day out, One would toil away at the shrines, and you woud go about supporting her endeavors. Prepare meals. Make sure she actually eats them. Keep the apartment from falling apart and stay up to date on political developments. <mp>Occasionally exchange a few electronic or physical telegrams with Spectra, since all your other contacts have went away over time- In various definitions of that term.
[]>narrator:You often go out and buy lots of nourishing fruit, when available. <mp>Difficult and expensive to come by, but everything for your wife and her work. <ap>Pomegrenates, mandarins, various nuts and root veggies.
[]>narrator:The sky is overcast with a thick blanket of sickly-green and grey clouds. It had been a while since you two went out for a date like this, owing to much of One's occupation with the oxylith shrines. 
[]>narrator:This foggy blanket chokes all life from the world. A perfect setting to soothe the soul and warm the body with pizza.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|happy,one-emotion|joy}:As you walk down one of the main artiries of the city, the clouds slowly lessen their chokehold, making space for the almost caustic sun rays to pierce the sky, and illuminate your walk. <mp>It feels warm on your skin, and on One's, when you brush your arms together.
[]>one: Hehe. Date time!
[]>anhedonia: Yay.
[]>narrator:One has been eerily quiet about yesterday. You might ask her later.
[]>anhedonia: How did it go today?
[]>one: Pretty good. Built up two more blanks today, ready for sculpting and stuff.
[]>anhedonia: I'm glad. Proud of you.
[]>one: Ehehe.
[]>one: Will work more tomorrow obviously.
[]>anhedonia: Of course you will.
[]>one: Also found a really neat music release!
[]>narrator: You continue chatting on your way to the pizzaria, talking about One's current creative processes, and you keeping the world together all around.
[]>narrator: The sky never really clears of its stone-thick clouds, still overcast when you finally take your seats.
[]>narrator: You get yourselves two massive pizzas, each freely taken from by either of you, occasionally even fed to the other. <mp>One and you might as well consider yourselves one shared metabolism. <lc>When you hold a piece to her mouth, you make cannot help but get lost in her face every time, and occasionally brush against her lips and cheeks. <mp>She does the same, eliciting small squeaks from you, while she tends to hum in comfy bliss. <lc>You generously keep repeating this spiel, showering each other in delicate affections whenever you can, legs pressed together, hands caressing one another between bites.
[]>narrator: You take forever to actually finish your food. <mp>That's ok.

[]>narrator: Snuggled up against one another on a random bench on your way home, the sun has finally fully broken through the clouds, and now heats you up on full blast. <lc>You simply enjoy each other's company, fingers interwoven and pizza box with leftovers next to you.
[]>one: I love you.
[]>anhedonia: I love you too, Sunshine.
[]>one: Eeeeee.
[]>narrator: One buries into your shoulder in response. <lc> You give her scalp a small nuzzling chu.
[]>anhedonia:By the way... did anything happen yesterday?
[]>one:Just... Errant bomb detonation.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:One...
[]>one:It's fine. <mp>It happens out there.
[]>anhedonia:You could've... <ap>died out there.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:But I didn't! So it's all fine.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:Please take good care of yourself.
[]>one:For now, I will.
[]>narrator:You squish her even tighter.
[]>anhedonia:Please do.

[]>narrator:Eventually, the sun has taken its course across the sky and you across the city. Back home and coming down from your outing spanning the afternoon and evening hours, you find yourselves simply basking in each other's presence.
[]>narrator:Without an illuminated celestial body overhead near the planet, you are dependent on the faint glow of light pollution to make out One's silhouette against the window.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty,one-emotion|joy}:Seeing you in these accursed city lights, it does something for me. <mp>You look so... beautiful. Your delicate outline, your... <ap>everything.
[]>one:Art of poetry also struck you, huh.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}:Sometimes. <mp>Having a wife helps elicit delicate prose.
[]>anhedonia{one-emotion|joy}:Your hair is the closest I'll ever get to seeing the moon. <mp>Your eyes are like the sun.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}:I love you.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:I love you too.

[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}:It's cold...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Wanna go cuddle then?
[]>one:Please.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Moments later, you find yourself nestled into one another underneath your blankets, yet the weight of yesterday still is not entirely lifted off of your chest.
[]>anhedonia:Should... <ap>Should something ever happen to you...
[]>one:Yea?
[]>anhedonia:Maybe you can give me a small overview of things? How to install shrines and stuff.
[]>one:...
[]>one:Sure... <mp>Not too big a fan of exposing my process like that.
[]>anhedonia:I know, Hun.
[]>one:But you.... do raise a good point. <mp>Don't wanna consolidate all knowledge in just this one brain.
[]>anhedonia:Mhm.
[]>one:Soon... When we have time properly.

[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Yea! If you want, we can even go over some more work together today. I'll show you some more intricacies of shrine making.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:I...
[]>one{one-emoition|anxious}:I...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:One? <mp>Are you ok?
[]>one:Fuck...

[]>narrator: In pain, you twist and arch your back and grind and clench your teeth.
[]>one: What the fuck.
[]>gods: Unable to pay the price?
[]>one: What fucking price?
[]>gods: Of wanting to become more...

[]>gods: Aren't you a bit enamored with the process of what could have been? What wouldve happened if you hadn't fucked up?
[]>one: Oh shut the hell up. I made peace with myself long ago.
[]>gods: You wouldn't have to slave away day in - day out. You wouldnt have to have your girlfriend-
[]>one: Don't you fucking dare.
[]>gods: Have your girlfriend prop you up.
[]>one: You know nothing.
[]>one: ...
[]>one: I love her.
[]>gods: A love to devour the world?
[]>one: She is the most important person in my life.
[]>gods: You all are ruthless. Perhaps the moon was right to abandon you.
[]>one: It just means... <ap>That's the point. With no moon, the night becomes ours to illuminate.
[]>gods: ...
[]>one: ...
[]>one: I don't know if it's a good thing. It happened long before our time. The moon listened and was compassionate. Had love for us. And they silenced her. Killed her. 
[]>one: ...
[]>one: But it's the only world we have ever known and if we don't show it the same ruthlessness then we are also just bound to burn up and die for nothing.
[]>gods: So you'd rather carry the fate of the world on your shoulders?
[]>one: Means I don't have to die at the hands of the state- Or some other authority.
[]>gods: Your body- <ap>your spine is our home. For now.
[]>gods: Take good care of it while we stay.
[]>one: I will.

content.content:
[]>narrator:Complete blackout. The godeyes subsumed your entire vision, and now you are back. <mp>Didn't know that could happen. <lc>You come to hunched over your desk- presumably on the next day? Deliriously slaving away at another oxylith with the grating fumes of the raw gel assaulting your nostrils. You might be starting to go insane. It won't last forever.
[]>narrator:The numerous eyes dotting your skin have startes to integrate into your spinal nerve, sending searing pain and overwhelming sensory signals to your head. The ceiling lights are too much.
[]>narrator:At day, the low hum and flicker of candles and LEDs turn to lighthouses around the apartment, and at night, even those turn dormant.
[]>narrator:Gods, you miss your sunflowers.
[]>narrator:Concernedly, Anhedonia leans against the doorframe to your bedroom.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:Is everything... Alright?
[]>one:Yea.
[]>anhedonia:You just kinda collapsed. Watched over you all night and now I find you here again. <mp>How much have you actually slept?
[]>one:No fucking idea.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:Ugh fuck... <lc>I think I--
[]>one:Yea.
[]>anhedonia:Huh?
[]>narrator:She steals a glance to your workbench.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:...
[]>one:Yea...
[]>anhedonia:How much did you inhale?
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:A... a lot.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:But you know... that's fine.

[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: This is when I burn the brightest. This is how I create.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...
[]>one{one-emotion|pain}: In fact- <mp>I am more than fine, I am perfect and I want to kill myself from all this sensory input.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}: At <call:control_camera,1.8,1.9,-0.7,3.0>any one time, it feels like I have five thoughts I want to speak but then I can't because I only have one mouth and time is linear and I am losing so much information I want to tell you and the world I see right now is so much bigger. <mp>It's infinite. Recursive. A fucking fractal.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one{one-emotion|pain}:Please you have to listen, the death is a great one and the clericants are not dead.[shake rate=8.0 level=3 connected=1] <mp>And not alive. <mp>They're nothing. [/shake] <mp>[shake rate=20.0 level=6 connected=1]FUCKING NOTHING.[/shake] They're soooooo beneath me I literally don't know why they still [shake rate=15.0 level=5 connected=1]EXIST![/shake]
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Those...<ap> That interrogated you?
[]>one: Yes and all the others and their class and why are they [shake rate=30.0 level=7 connected=1]STILL ALIIIIVE???[/shake] 
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:[shake rate=8.0 level=3 connected=1]I've talked, seen, commuted, fucked with perforated angels. [/shake]What lives in there, it's big.
[]>anhedonia: In.. Where?
[]>one: Me. <call:control_camera,2.2,2.2,-1,5.0>God. Godseed.
[]>narrator: You vigorously point at your face.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:Sorry, what's in there?
[]>one{one-emotion|pain}:Angels. Architects and more talking and they're talking as we speak.
[]>anhedonia: Are they saying something about us?
[]>narrator: The world flatlines. <call:control_camera,1,0,0,5.0>Silence.
[]>one: Doesn't matter.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia is in front of you.
[]>one: You're still here.
[]>anhedonia: Where would I go?
[]>one: Away of course.
[]>anhedonia: I'm not gonna leave you alone when your thoughts are racing like this!
[]>one: No I mean this reality, which might only exist in this room for all intents and purposes .... But still.[shake rate=20.0 level=6 connected=1] FUCK. SHIIIITT[/shake] [shake rate=8.0 level=3 connected=1]reality just dissolved again.[/shake]
[]>anhedonia: I'm here. 
[]>one{one-emotion|crying}:I know you are. I mean here. In this reality.
[]>narrator:Your eyes throb. The base of your spine feels like a scalpel embedded in your skin.
[]>one: This will take a long long time to work through.
[]>anhedonia: What will?

[]>one: All these thoughts I just had. They're burrowed now. Burrowed in my spine and head and cerebellum.
[]>anhedonia: Will they come back?
[]>one: How should I know? Probably. I'll let you know when they do.
[]>one:...
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: My head hurts.
[]>anhedonia: Come here.

[]>narrator: She opens her arms. <mp>You lean into them. <mp>She pats your head. <mp>A familiar cadence, the comfort of home.
[]>one: This feels so good. <mp>And like you're hammering a cymbal out of my cranium. Made of brass, clatter and clang.
[]>anhedonia: Should I stop?
[]>one: No...
[]>narrator: Anhedonia gently carresses your skull more.
[]>one: Thank you for being a tether.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Gladly.
[]>narrator: You lean more and more into her. After a while, you make your way to the bed, and the eyes keep seeing everything and draping lunar embraces over your frontal lobe from far far away but Anhedonia is right here in front of you and that is enough for peace. <mp>For today.
[]>narrator:The dawn has broken long ago and so did your sanity. Yesterday has been slept off, but not entirely.

[]>one:It is so fucking PAINFUL to THINK!
[]>one:Annnheedooniiiaaaaaa!!!
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sleepy}:Ugh... Hi.
[]>one:I went back into the thought mines today and how my head is full of holes and they're being filled with cement and love as we speak.

[]>one:I'm just so close to breaking, Annie. I'm afraid of what if... what if I don't finish any of this in time.
[]>one:Those fuckers raided me and took so much and now rebuilding all this before I kick the bucket is... FUCK.

[]>narrator: Anhedonia is struggling to keep up with your deliberations. Currently, she is but resorting to merely clinging to you, holding you close.
[]>anhedonia: I know hun... It's all so much.
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia: ... We'll be fine.
[]>one: Will we?
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying}: Is there nothing I can do to alleviate this burden?
[]>one: No.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one: ...
[]>one: Oh fuck. Anhedonia I am so sorry.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one: I didn't want to make you sad. Please don't...
[]>anhedonia: I know it wasn't your intention.
[]>one: But still... I...
[]>one: Well... For now I know that I'm succeeding.
[]>anhedonia: ...Why?
[]>one: Otherwise I'd be dead.
[]>narrator: Your last remark makes Anhedonia squeeze you even harder, practically locking you in place next to her, blanket draped over both of you.
[]>one: I'm sorry my thoughts are like this.
[]>anhedonia: *sniffle* It's fine...

content.content:
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious,anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:So... I have the next target set. I know where I need to plant the next shrine. <mp>But we have an issue, kinda.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:Oh?
[]>one:It is...
[]>one{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:Right at the clerifugium.
[]>anhedonia:Ughhhh...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}:How do we even deal with that?
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:Blind luck?
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:It'll be concealed and unmovable like the rest of them but still... I'll need you to watch out for me.
[]>anhedonia:I mean.. How danger close are we talking?
[]>one:Right next to it. As in... Its mornward wing. In the alley next to it, attached to the wall kinda deal.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:This... <ap>is <call:control_camera,1.6,0.0,-0.5,2.0>a mess.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}:I know it is!
[]>anhedonia:There's gonna be clericants all over the place. If any of them recognize us, we're dead.
[]>one:It's not like they all know all their heretics all the time.
[]>anhedonia:Oculars do.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:Yea...
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}:Like I said... Blind luck.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|dismissive}:Literally.
[]>narrator:You let out a sigh, trying not to alarm One too much. Or maybe she does know how risky it is.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}:...We <call:control_camera,1,0,0,4.0>just have no choice.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:I know...
[]>one:If we don't place the shrines exactly in formation it'll go sideways big time.
[]>anhedonia:Yep... <mp>So let's bank on blind luck then.
[]>narrator:You grab your lover's hand.
[]>one:Let's.

[]>anhedonia:So... what now?
[]>one:Well most of the preparations for tomorrow have been taken care of.
[]>anhedonia:We're doing this tomorrow already?
[]>one:Can't fuck around forever.
[]>anhedonia:Guess so.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:Then... let's not anxiously rot around until tomorrow.
[]>one:Agreed.
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}:I... <ap>have an idea for a lovely evening.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}:And what would that be?
[]>one:Well... <ap>what if we...

[]>narrator:The two of you share a lovely dinner, enjoying each other's company, basking in this moment of serene bliss before tomorrow.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy,one-emotion|joy}:I love you.
[]>narrator:One nuzzles against your shoulder in reciprocity.
[]>one:You too.
[]>narrator:As you snuggle on the couch, watching braindead TV programs, One pipes up, slowly squeezing your fingers with each trailing thought.

[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: Before tomorrow...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Hm?
[]>one: I have a few spots left...
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}: Unmarred, you know..
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: Unmarred...
[]>one: Do you...
[]>narrator: One steals a glance over to her toolbox on the shelf.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: ...<lc>Would you...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: Would I?
[]>narrator: Her eyes open into pleading puppy eyes. A grin starts forming on your mouth and you grab her face by the cheeks.
[]>anhedonia: Would <ap>I <ap>what?
[]>one:...
[]>anhedonia: Speak, plaything.
[]>narrator: Her gaze fixates even harder on you at the pet name. She vocalizes with the neediness of a frail porcelain doll in need of breaking.
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}: Would you... <ap>Well, would you like to change that?
[]>narrator: At the implied request, you let your eyes wander at the emaciated and eye-ridden form beneath you. <mp>Half godflesh, half... <ap>human. <mp>Dead eyes erratically fluttering their focal points across space, half-blinking and half-crying. <mp>And in One's skull: The most beautiful irises you have ever dared gaze into.
[]>anhedonia: You're so pretty, you know that?
[]>narrator: Your hand trails the thin path of yet-eyeless skin on One's arm.
[]>anhedonia: I'd be honored to decorate your skin some more.
[]>narrator: A quick peck, and you slowly rise. You fold out the couch, then press One down on it again with a gentle push of your fingertips against her chest. <mp>So little resistance against you. <lc>When your girl has laid down again, you make your way over to the toolbox. <mp>Retrieve the box cutter. <mp>Slot in a new blade. <mp>Adjust its length with intent and a loud rapping. <mp>Turn around to One, laying there, <ap>in anticipation.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>narrator: You shift your eyes to the implement.
[]>anhedonia: This...? On you? 
[]>one:...
[]>narrator: You look at her silent silhouette again.
[]>anhedonia: You want this?
[]>narrator{one-emotion|joy}: One<call:control_camera,1.5,0.4,-0.2,3.0> responds with a vigorous nod. And so, one foot before the next, you return to the couch.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible,one+anhedonia-emotion|knifeplay1}: Kneeling on the foldout mattress, you put the knife down, and caress her some more. The air is filled with nought but constant breathing. Her tense and exicted anticipation. Your calm introversion. <lc> You trail your hands up and down her body- <mp>Countless gentle touches across every spec of her skin.

[]>narrator: With an arch of her back and sweetly-pitched moans leaving her, One beckons for more of your touch at every turn. You caress her waist and she practically follows your lead as if you were grabbing her on both sides. With a knee planted firmly between her legs, you place your other hand against her mouth and she starts salivating all over it as if she never had a more vital nourishment. <lc>Grinding her need against your thigh, you cannot help but groan back at her in desperation. <mp>This fucking girl. <lc>You twist your hand and shove two fingers down her throat and One never bats an eye. <mp>In a few spots of skinship, you feel the extreme warmth coming from the eyes dotting her lithe form.
[]>anhedonia: You feel so fucking amazing hun...
[]>narrator: As if she could respond with anything but slobbering even more eagerly over your fingers.
[]>narrator: You love her so damn much.
[]>narrator: But then, you release your hold on her face and tongue and relish the taste of One's spit on your own fingers, making sure never to break eye contact as you move into a more comfortable position.
[]>narrator: You give her hips another squeeze and elicit a yelp suited for helpless prey- Ready to be slaughtered.
[]>narrator: You pick up the box cutter once more.
[]>anhedonia: Ready?
[]>one: Yea... <mp>Please.
[]>anhedonia: Alright then...
[]>narrator: You gently place the tip of the blade dead-center on One's sternum.
[]>anhedonia: Then I'll start.
[]>narrator: One sustains her affirmations, gentle nodding along to each of your words.
[]>anhedonia: You're such a good girl...

[]>narrator:And then finally, your blade breaks the first layer of her skin. Small droplets of blood form inside this small chasm where you pierced a few layers deeper.<lc>Cat scratches.
[]>one:This feels so nice.
[]>anhedonia:It does?
[]>one:Mhm.
[]>anhedonia:Cute little masochist likes getting cut up to shit?
[]>one:I love it.
[]>one:I...
[]>one:Gods...
[]>one:Heh...
[]>narrator:How could she heckle in this situation? You tilt your head at her.
[]>one:This is... <ap>A ghost of a sensation. <mp>An empty threat.
[]>narrator:Your eyes narrow at her remark.
[]>anhedonia:...Snarky little one...
[]>one:Shut me up then. <mp>Make it real.
[]>narrator:With those words, her voice burns into your soul.
[]>one:Sculpt my flesh.
[]>one:The blade is real and so grace my body with it...
[]>anhedonia:You mean... Deeper?
[]>one:Yes. <mp>Please. <mp>Hurt me properly.
[]>anhedonia:I... <ap>will.
[]>one:Hehehehe. <mp>Fucking gut me.

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|knifeplay2}: Without hesitation you deftfully twist the knife across One's skin, into her flesh. You paint a deep and palm-sized laceration across her tummy, followed by a most hedonistic groan. <mp>Blood instantly oozes from the wound, pooling around One's navel, and flowing down along her hips and groin.
[]>narrator: With a pained expression, One directs her eyes from their blissful glazed state to fixate on you. Then the wound. Then you. Eyes darting back and forth, until a manic grin emerges on her satisfied face.
[]>one: Oh my god... That's so much...
[]>narrator: You lazily let your eyes wander up her form, then back down to the wound.
[]>anhedonia: Too much?
[]>one: Not at all.
[]>narrator: Blissfully, One lets her head roll back.
[]>one: Annie.... I love you..
[]>narrator: You gently begin massaging her abdomen, trailing your hand freely across exposed skin.
[]>anhedonia: I love you too, Sunshine.
[]>one: Hehe... Heh... Hmnmhm...
[]>narrator: Slowly but steadily, One starts squirming against your caressing hand.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>narrator: Her motions intensify with your proximity to the wound, as do her breathy moans.
[]>anhedonia:... <lc>Oh my...
[]>one: Wha... Hhm?
[]>anhedonia: Getting off on squeezing your own blood out?
[]>one: <call:control_camera,1.6,0.7,0.0,1.0>Please don't stop.
[]>narrator: She instantly drops to the most desperate tone.
[]>narrator: With a gentle touch, you continue massaging around her wound, letting your hand rest on the various parts of her that have been sketched out by time. <mp>Skin broken by eyes, healed self-harm scars, stretch marks, and all kinds of small imperfections. <mp>She is absolutely gorgeous like this.
[]>narrator: You could indulge in this view for hours, were it not for One eventually needily looking up at you.
[]>one: Please... There's gloves in my... Workbench.
[]>anhedonia: ?
[]>one: Nitrile ones, so can you massage it properly...

[]>narrator: You slowly recede from One's form, and quickly rise to retrieve the gloves. <mp>Searching through the drawers, the tent you've been pitching since you started occasionally bumps against the dissheveled piles of paper lying around. <mp>The added pressure makes you notice how wet you are too from this. <lc>But no time for horny brainfog, you have a wound to massage.
[]>narrator: A few seconds later, you take out a pair of black nitrile gloves, and turn to return to One once more. Deftly you put on the gloves without missing a beat.

[]>anhedonia: Hey. <mp>I'm back.
[]>narrator: You carefully place your palm on her abdomen, to which she lightly jolts in response.
[]>anhedonia: I got the gloves. <mp>Heh.
[]>one: Hmhnhgn... <mp>Then what are you waiting for??? <lc>Caress it. <mp>Please.
[]>anhedonia:You are so so needy, you know that?
[]>one:Mnmbgmnfghff...

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|knifeplay3}: Slowly you make your way up her abdominal wall, up to the laceration. One's heart rate and breathing speed are quite low, considering the circumstances. <mp>But the beating itself is strong- Spilling forth a new droplet of blood on every beat. <mp>Yet you crawl up higher and higher, until finally, your index finger hovers over the incision. <mp>And you press down.

[]>narrator: Immediately, more blood springs forth, a warm embrace bedewing the outside of your gloves. A gently growing wave of iron kisses your nostrils with every passing moment, a volatile invitation to your predatory instincts. <mp>One is your prey, <ap>and your prey alone.
[]>narrator: A bit of prey eager to be consumed, as she presses her body against your hand with errant twitches, yearning for more of your touch. The instincts that drove you to cut into her lead you further provide her with pleasured suffering, eagerly pressing your hand against her abdomen in a steady rhythm as if you were getting her off. <mp>Perhaps you are. <ap>She's definitely getting off on this.
[]>narrator: One interweaves sharp exhalation with gyrating squirms. <ap>In return, you coo sweet hums into the air, assuring her of your unfaltering support. May she know that you will be both her destroyer and savior in this. <mp>With time, your other hand finds itself idle, and so you shuffle slightly upwards so you can hold your lovers's hand. She instantly responds by grasping yours fast. Your eyes find one another, gentle smiles growing on both of your faces.
[]>narrator: Her hand is so warm.
[]>narrator: As is her blood.
[]>anhedonia: Thank you for letting me do this to you.
[]>one: Mhm...
[]>one: You're so good to me...
[]>one: Carving so... Fuuuckk...
[]>one: I love you.
[]>anhedonia: I love you too. <lc>My beautiful wife.
[]>one: Hehe.
[]>anhedonia: Perfect vessel.
[]>one: Meow.
[]>anhedonia: Heh... Cute.
[]>narrator: As you continue caressing her body and her hand, One rolls her head back and forth in pleasure, moaning out into the night when you get close to the abdominal wound. A divine sight, floating atop a pool of blood and love.
[]>narrator: When she tells you to stop, it is not out of distain but out of necessity, not wanting to bleed out here, and to prevent unneccessary pain as the hormonal rush to her head recedes. <mp>You gladly follow her request, providing her with disciplined bandaging and specially-reserved painkillers and affectionate touches. <mp>This girl is truly a blessing to your freak mind, and you are to her. <mp>You love her so so much.

[]>narrator:You conclude your gruesome affections by lowering your head and placing a kiss on her tummy, just below the wound. <mp>You kiss more and more, lower and lower until you allow yourself to a brief and playful taste of One's clit. <lc>You continue on your journey, feasting on One's eyes and scars and juicy thighs. <mp>And finally, you conclude with traveling up her body again, tasting all of her delicious skin and blood and then make her taste herself too. <lc>Juggling droplets of One's blood in between your tongues, you do not relent until One's mouth too is full of her own red. <mp>Mixed with your own saliva, One is carried on top of a sea of bloodied sexual fluids. <ap>You wouldn't have it any other way.
[]>narrator:scene in bathroom where they giggle and look at each other in the mirror
[]>narrator: You pin One against the wall and make out with her

[]>narrator:The clerifugium stands tall in the city's administrative district. A grand structure, and one of incredible violence. <mp>This is where some of your records probably are. <lc>According to One's calculations, the shrine falls right in the side alley of the clericant's institutional headquarters. <mp>You shouldn't be here. <lc>This alley is a fucking death trap.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned,one-emotion|anxious}:What do I do if I spot any clericants?
[]>one:I don't know... <mp>We just hope we won't see any.<lc>This cycle of state violence can't continue. It's not sustainable. <mp>We'll turn it into a fucking spiral of violence, with us at the terminus.
[]>narrator:One cranes her neck up for a brief yet intense kiss before she strides off into the back alley.

[]>narrator{one-emotion|invisible}:Oxyliths are fascinating in how they they stand diametrically opposed to their environment. the dead city pulse serving as injection point for your own hope, One's own blood, brought forth in no small part by you.
[]>narrator:Occasionally, you glance over to One. <mp>Your primary task here however, is to make sure no one spots her.
[]>narrator:Expertly, she quickly carves a hold into the side wall of the clerifugium to anchor the shrine to.

[]>narrator:Suddenly, from across the plaza in front of the institution, you spot a patrol squad of clericants. <mp>Five of them. <ap>Fuck.
[]>narrator:Worse yet, they also spot you. Squads of this size usually have an aetherlink to their central database, or at least an ocular to identify any targets.
[]>narrator:Targets, such as you. The ocular stares at you with their cyclopean mask, and you stare back. A yawning abyss, just a few seconds of sprinting away from you. If you were to turn back to One, you'd just alert them to her presence as well.
[]>narrator:The more distance you can create between yourself and One the better, leaving you with but one option, which is to move to meet them before they can turn the corner and spot One- <mp>You hope to death this works out.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:Almost immediately, you find yourself slammed into the ground. Skull ringing, vision blurry, arms constricted. <mp>The stench of oil and rot and rust on top of you is unbearable. 
[]>clericant:You are hereby under immediate arrest for herecy, loitering, and premeditated assault. <lc>Be silent or be guilty.
[]>narrator:You didn't expect things to go this south. Losing conciousness almost immediately, you flicker in and out of knowhing what the fuck is happening to you every couple of minutes.

[]>narrator:The clerifugium is a building marred by supposed glory of days past. The ancient cathedral archways haunt the space from outside, suggesting at a spiritual purpose once. Maybe for them it still is.
[]>narrator:Past the arches, you are greeted to desolate hallways; Massive and dense, and yet grand and tall in their construction.
