[]>narrator: Ahnedonia informs you that it is about lunch time. <mp>You have difficulty focusing on her eyes.
[]>one: Holy fuck... This is....
[]>one: Potent...
[]>one: So... Heavy...
[]>one: I feel so heavy...
[]>anhedonia: What about the pain?
[]>one: What pain?
[]>one: ...
[]>one: Oh, yea, the pain... <lc>...<lc>...Gone.
[]>one: Granted... <ap>So is half my sense of... <ap>Feeling? <ap>Sense of touch.
[]>anhedonia: Mhm.
[]>narrator: You nuzzle further into her lap again, desperate to feel her warmth against you.
[]>one: This is nice though.
[]>anhedonia: I'm glad.
[]>narrator: She continues stroking your head throughout.

[]>narrator: When you can move your muscles again to prop yourself up in an upright position, the sun has gone past the zenith again, but not too far. Exhaustion is writ on your face, but it feels infinitely better than the assault on your senses from your skin breaking and witnessing realities beyond your comprehension. <lc>While not much, you conclude the day with more theoretical work, writing more verses to inscribe upon the remaining shrines, all the while being fed shredded fruit by your girlfriend.
[]>narrator: When the sun has set, you have a lovely little dinner date, Anhedonia preparing fried protein and soup for you.
[]>narrator: You lean on her in between bites, and she nuzzles your scalp and strokes your arms and back in return. So soft.
[]>anhedonia: I'm glad it worked.
[]>one: Me too...
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia: Hey, by the way, I was curious.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: Hm?
[]>anhedonia:How did you get out, anyways?
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Well...

[]>narrator:As you are escorted along the walkways, you sometimes come across the edge of the tunnels, with a view into the void and chasm below. Open-sky torture chambers, except the sky too- is this accursed cathedral.<lc>Bodies are piled, stacked, impaled down there. The stench is fucking unbearable. Sometimes you vomit over the edge and apologize to the deceased below.
[]>narrator:Eventually, you are brought forth for another round of mental torture in one of their rooms.
[]>interrogator{interrogator-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}:Do you know for how long you have been down here now?

[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: Come on, take a guess.
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: What do you think? <mp>Answer.
[]>one: ...
[]>one: Long enough.
[]>interrogator: Feeling funny today, are we?
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: This silence will not help you.
[]>one: ...
[]>narrator: "Feels good though.", you think to yourself.

[]>interrogator: Two solar cycles.
[]>one{one-emotion|anxious}: No...
[]>narrator: This probably is a lie. You discard the information without thought.
[]>narrator: It felt like more. Vastly more.
[]>interrogator: ...
[]>interrogator: Hah.
[]>one: ?
[]>interrogator: The look on your face just now, "it can't have been that long?", right?
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: Correct.
[]>interrogator: I'm also feeling funny today.

[]>interrogator: It's not even been one cycle.
[]>narrator: Your spiked heartrate pounds up into your throat. Yet you attempt to remain calm, for this all might just be made up.
[]>interrogator: You will be in here for a long time, miss.
[]>interrogator: I will remind you that when we apprehended you, you and that... <ap>Other individual were in the process of drug abuse.
[]>one: She never did anything...
[]>narrator: That's what you gave to protocol. It's the story the world will run on.
[]>interrogator: ...<ap>They... Burdened ...<ap>Their... Criminal record with conspiracy and heresy by associating with you.
[]>one: You have something on her?
[]>interrogator: This does not concern you.

[]>interrogator: So tell me again, where is the godseed?
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: Can you really stand hours of silence?
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: If you fall asleep, it is back to the torture chambers.
[]>interrogator: We will expell this self-idolizing from you one way or another.
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: And you will mourn the person you lost. All preventable had you had surrenderred earlier.
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: You will accept this sacred house as your superior, and offer the seed to it.
[]>one: ...
[]>narrator: They'd only destroy it.
[]>interrogator: You will bow your head and prostrate your self.
[]>interrogator: Where is the godseed?
[]>one: ...
[]>interrogator: We possess unending endurance.
[]>one: [shake rate=30.0 level=7 connected=1]COME AND GET ME WITH ALL YOUR FALSE IDOLS THEN YOU FUCKS!
[]>interrogator: [shake rate=50.0 level=21 connected=1]SILENCE YOU DEGENERATE HEATHEN!

[]>narrator: Although you find yourself physically unharmed, the impact reverberates throughout the desk and echoes in this concrete room enough to feel it in your bones regardless.
[]>interrogator: You are naught but a brazen child, and a danger to all civilized life.
[]>interrogator: If we had the chance to eradicate you completely we would without hesitation, make no mistake.
[]>interrogator: Your only saving grace is the fact of the matter that you might be still of use to the clergy.
[]>one: ...Use?
[]>interrogator: Your... Research. It is of interest to some.
[]>one: ...
[]>narrator: When your abode kept being raided, you started committing the lynchpins to memory. They don't know half of it.
[]>one: So... You'll leave me alive.
[]>interrogator: For now.
[]>interrogator: I will also reiterate that your transgressions will continue to have ruinuous consequences for you. You may know freedom if the lunar will allows it.

[]>one: My transgressions?
[]>interrogator: Your transgressions. 
[]>one: What even are those?
[]>interrogator: We know.
[]>one: You do?
[]>interrogator: We do.
[]>one: You don't know shit.
[]>interrogator: Come again?

[]>one: You don't even know what you're looking for. You're all a bunch of bloodied amateurs.
[]>interrogator: ...
[]>interrogator: You are inmate 1138. Former sunflower gardener, presumed disruption to the clerical flow.
[]>one: A... Terrorist?
[]>interrogator: A terrorist.
[]>one: Interesting.
[]>one: And who told you that? Superiors that you definitely know the motives of? Don't kid yourself. 
[]>interrogator: Us clericants know why you are here.
[]>one: That's what you were told. <mp>You have no fucking idea who I am.
[]>interrogator: ...
[]>interrogator:Dismissed.

34.page_key: torture #3 "you can't know who I am"

content.content:
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|shock}:You... Made them believe the higher clergy sent you in?
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:No fucking idea what they thought. But something along those lines seems plausible, yea.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}: Girl... You are an absolute menace. <mp>I'm so into you.
[]>one: Hehe.
[]>one: But yeah. As I mentioned before <ap>blanket time, you'll need my blood. <ap>Probably.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}: I recall.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: How are you feeling?
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: Way better than this morning. <mp>Whatever the metabolized half-stage of this shit is... It's interesting.
[]>one: The comedown is very smooth.
[]>anhedonia: No pain?
[]>one: Barely. For now.
[]>anhedonia: I'm glad.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>one: ...
[]>one: It's so late.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: Sorry for... Taking up so much time with... Being drugged and shit.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Oh come on. It's no big deal for me. <mp>I'll gladly take care of you- Always. Make sure you're feeling... Not like absolute shit.
[]>one: You're sweet.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|flirty}}: Of course, for my wife especially.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}}: Hehe. Me?
[]>anhedonia: Of course.
[]>narrator: You nuzzle into Anhedonia in glee.

[]>narrator: As you cuddle for a bit longer, it is not long until you feel like the weight of reality starts to rest on top of you again. <mp>With the pain across your skin and spine threatening to reemerge already, you suggest bed time for today, to which Anhedonia concurs. <lc>Spooned up against your girlfriend, you fall into a gentle sleep for the first time in days, if not weeks.

[]>narrator: The next morning comes with little surprises. The pain is largely back, yet more bearable somehow, as if Anhedonia's care lingers like an aegis over your body.
[]>narrator: When you jointly crawl out of bed, the needles and other medical supplies of yesterday still greet you on your coffee table.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}: True...
[]>one: Yep. You still need my blood.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}: Have I not taken enough from you already?
[]>one{one-emotion|horny}: Your mouth does't count.
[]>anhedonia: Aw. Sad.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: Hehe.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}: Awa.
[]>one: Nya... <mp>Okay, fuck. <ap>Blood.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Breakfast first? Don't want you fainting on me.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: Sure...
[]>anhedonia: Small nibble.
[]>one: Not on me.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}}: I KNOW!!!
[]>one: Freak.
[]>anhedonia: You.
[]>narrator: You share a quick hug. The adoration for Anhedonia in your chest is so overbearing sometimes.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral,one-emotion|neutral}: So... wanna get to it?
[]>narrator: With breakfast in your system, and hands interlocked with hers, you smile at Anhedonia.
[]>one: ...Yea... Let's draw some blood.

[]>narrator: The setup is quite simple. With a needle injected into one of your veins, you let it rest below your heart. From there, a line runs into a vacuum-sealed collection vessel, which automatically distributes it into smaller phials for ease of transportation. <lc>You need a lot of blood, but there's only so much throughput. At least the sensory feeling of bloodletting is... Marginal at worst, oddly freeing at best.
[]>narrator: Waiting for the blood to drain at this rate is quite uneventful, yet still critical enough for Anhedonia to insist on watching over you, hand in hand.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}: On the scale of... Esoteric lesbian sex... <mp>Where is bloodletting?
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}: Pffft. Hehehe.
[]>one: Well...
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: Highly esoteric, for sure. <mp>Especially with the handholding.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}: Haha, true.
[]>one: I'm so happy I met you. <mp>It feels like if you unbound our souls from our bodies, they'd fuse into one.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Likewise.
[]>one: I...
[]>one: I really am worth all this effort to you... Watching over me, drawing my blood, and stuff. <mp>You do so much for me.
[]>anhedonia: Of course. <mp>Like you said; Bound by soul, and very much bound by blood too.
[]>one: Bound by blood indeed.

[]>narrator: The vessel is half-filled now.
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: It's also why I do art- The shrines and poetry mostly.
[]>one: But I want you to know that there are whispers of destiny within me. <mp>I can feel our hearts, woven togther, in the fabrtic of the cosmos. <mp>And the ability to show that, or even just a glimpse or attempt at it. That feels really good to me. <lc>...<lc>It's a bit ironic, I think. That this last endeavor will be... So final. And that you- <ap>My muse and object of artistic devotion- <ap>Will vanish alongside it.
[]>anhedonia: I'm fine with it.
[]>one{one-emotion|neutral}: Heh. I know. <lc>Working towards the end reduces our time together, what a trade.
[]>one: But we can't not.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}: Death as a great attractor.
[]>one: Precisely.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: If I may note... You never talked about your reasons in this much detail.
[]>one: You never asked.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Well, I thought you were apprehensive about it.
[]>one: Usually I am. But currently I feel like sharing.
[]>anhedonia: So I was right to not ask?
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: Heh, I guess.
[]>anhedonia: So... How do you do art?
[]>one: With my hands.
[]>anhedonia: Clever. You know that's not what I meant.
[]>one: I know that you know.
[]>one: Sigh...
[]>one: It just comes to me like the world has a heartbeat. And I am merely extracting its expressions. There's not much beyond that.
[]>anhedonia: Just vibes?
[]>one: Just vibes and self-expression.
[]>anhedonia: Mhm.
[]>anhedonia: Oh, let me unplug you.

[]>narrator: The phials are now completely filled. Over the course of your conversation, you could feel the hypotension climb, with less and less blood running through your system. Yet, this isn't too bad. Not too dizzy, and easily drowned out by the static and noise and pressure from the godeyes and their cosmic echoes.
[]>narrator: You observe your girlfriend as she removes the needle from your arm, patches you up, and subsequently seals up the phials as well.
[]>one: Annie.
[]>anhedonia: Yeah?

[]>one: Thank you. For... Doing this.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Of course.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}: This work... It's still a big ask. And I'm a bit afraid you'll resent me for it.
[]>narrator:She sets the bloodletting gear aside and sits down right next to you, and takes your hand in hers.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: Why would I resent you? I love you.
[]>one: Oh you know, because I'll be leaving you to pick up the pieces, <ap>again. <lc>...<lc>This time for good.
[]>anhedonia: One... This isn't you breaking something for me to clean up. You're not doing anything wrong.
[]>one:I know... But...
[]>one: It feels too much like ground truth to me- <mp>The fact that I don't really feel bad.
[]>one:And that hurts too, like I don't value your feelings...
[]>one{one-emotion|crying}:But I do. <lc>I truly do.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy}: I know. I treasure you too.<lc>But I also know that this is what you want.
[]>narrator: You nod your head ourwards, toward the window.
[]>one: All of this just inspires so much hate. You're the only remaining love here and I'll kill you with this.
[]>anhedonia:I know, darling. And I am fine with that. <lc>I love you.
[]>one{one-emotion|sad}:You're so sweet...
[]>one: You just live in my heart too, just as the godseed.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: Thank you for letting me be- Exist in your heart. <mp>But you are so much grander than me. You can have the world, and I want you to.
[]>narrator: Your grip on Anhedonia's hands weakens. Hers fastens in response.
[]>anhedonia{one-emotion|listening}:And I am part of that world I want you to have. <mp>So do with me, and with it, as you please.
[]>anhedonia: The godseed is your opus, your calling, your creation. Please don't stop for anyone, not even me.
[]>narrator: You feel the tears swelling as you share a long and drawn-out fixation into one another's eyes.
[]>one: You're really not.. Upset?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|concerned}: I never want to be angry at you. Least of all because of you following your heart.

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|hug-eye3-crying,anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible}: You collapse into her chest and arms, a trickle of tears now running down your face and into Anhedonia's collar.<lc>You stay like this for a little while, sobbing and crying and screaming with a resplendent thankfulness and also- Grief.
[]>one: Hmhnhwwh... Thank... Hwghw.. Youuu...
[]>narrator: In response, she nuzzles your head and scritches your nape. <lc>You stay like this for a while longer.
[]>narrator: Eventually, at least you look up again, to find Anhedonia smiling at you, even if your tears still won't stop.
[]>one: ...<mp>Thank you.
[]>narrator: She squeezes you tight.
[]>one: Thank you.
[]>anhedonia: Always.
[]>narrator:Yet another day concluded with you sobbing into Anhedonia's arms, and yet another morning breaks to greet you with toxic atmosphere lining the sky outside.

[]>one:you flick through the pages, and between your marred fingers, they become like water. the softcovers bend to the violence of your grip, and deft thumbs keep tension on the cusp of the volume's fore edge. your gaze washes over the contents, and in a miment, you stop aat the one you need. your repeat this mental swimming exercise a handful of times more. when you emerge from your now-ransacked library, it is victorious. instructions in hand. references to other works. a guide to navigating this sea of knowledge. <lc> today, and over a bottle of wine, anhedonia will receive this guide.
[]>one:And tomorrow we let blood flow. You'll make a great constructor.

content.content:
[]>narrator{one-emotion|pain,anhedonia-emotion|sleepy}: You are nudged awake. One stands over you, blood drizzling down her chin.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|shock}: One... <ap>Fuck... <ap>What happened?
[]>one: Heh... Damn it... Hey Annie. <mp>I know it's late in the evening but.. <ap>uhm... <ap>do you think we could take a walk? <mp>Togther- <ap>Outside.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: ...
[]>one: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}: ...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying}:... <ap>Sure.

[]>narrator: You ask One if you can assist her, and she declines- For now. You merely act as chaperon and companion here, a ferry for this final step of her work.
[]>narrator:With worrying shivers and a noticeable weakness, One gathers her things- a small pouch she slings across her hip.

[]>anhedonia: One...
[]>one{one-emotion|listening}: Yea?
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}: You asked me something and I said I'd think about it...
[]>one: Huh?
[]>anhedonia: The... Assisted dying.
[]>one: What about it?
[]>anhedonia:It never was a question. <mp>Of course I'd do it.
[]>anhedonia: You still have the tools right?
[]>one: Of course... <lc>I do.
[]>anhedonia: Still up for it?
[]>one: I... <ap>Yes.
[]>anhedonia: Good, could you get them? <mp>We can talk on the way.
[]>one{one-emotion|joy}:Already packed them.
[]>anhedonia:Sneaky.
[]>one:Heh. <ap>I know my girlfriend well.

content.content:
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|concerned,one-emotion|pain}: Walking up the hill, you desperately cling to Anhedonia. <mp>Your hand never leaves her, and your arms touch all the way, all in an effort to indulge in as much skinship as possible. <lc>The pain burning up beneath your skin makes it almost impossibly difficult to walk upright. <mp>Your arms yearn to twist and bend in any way that makes the agony go away, and intermittently, you spit out pools of blood.
[]>narrator:It is a slow walk up to the bench. <mp>Anhedonia never lets go if your hand either.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|happy,one-emotion|joy}: I love you so much.
[]>one: I love you too, Annie.
[]>anhedonia: My little Sunshine.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|crying,one-emotion|crying}: As you speak, you're both pushing through your tears, radiant smiles enough to drive away the pitch black of the moonless night overhead.
[]>anhedonia: You always made the nights together so much more bearable.
[]>one: Mhm.
[]>anhedonia: I...
[]>narrator: She gives your hand more gentle caresses, quickly steps in front of you to tower over you for a quick kiss.
[]>narrator: You lean in as much as your writhing and eye-covered body allows.
[]>anhedonia: My heart beats so fast.
[]>one: Mine too.
[]>anhedonia: ...
[]>narrator: Another small chu.
[]>one: Let's go...
[]>anhedonia: Yea...
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>one:...<lc>So... You'll do it?
[]>anhedonia:The injection?
[]>one:Yea.
[]>anhedonia:I will.
[]>one{one-emotion|crying}:...<lc>You're sweet.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|smug}: I didn't spend these last 3 years in lockstep with you just to watch you fade out now.
[]>one:I...

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...
[]>one:I love you so fucking much.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|sad,one-emotion|pain}: You finally reach the bench, a lonely and forgotten place. A place of so many memories. Desires. Wishes.

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|injection1,anhedonia-emotion|invisible,one-emotion|invisible}: With familiar steps, you descend the few steps down the muddied path and seat yourselves like you have done so many times. 
[]>narrator: From the small bag you took with you, you take a palm-sized crystal disc, which has a gentle glow about it. You hand it to Anhedonia so she can put it down next to her, bathing her in the echoes of the pink lightning you'd sometimes see overhead.
[]>one: You're so pretty.
[]>anhedonia: As are you.
[]>narrator: Her eyes do not relent. <mp>Against the contrast of night, they appear as radiant and violently pink as they ever could be. 
[]>one:...

[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|injection2}: Briskly, the moment is interrupted by the need to evacuate blood from your mouth.
[]>one: Fuck...
[]>anhedonia: We gotta hurry, don't we?
[]>one: I think I can... Feel my innards dissolving.
[]>anhedonia: One??

[]>narrator: From your bag, you retrieve an envelope.
[]>one: Here, for you.
[]>narrator: It is incredibly difficult to read the lettering on the front, the distant city light's glow but a faint aid.
[]>narrator:"To Anhedonia"

[]>one: I dont know if we have enough time to read it together now...
[]>anhedonia: There's never enough.
[]>one: There never... Hhjghh... Is.
[]>one: ...
[]>one: I think it's time.
[]>narrator: Another quick yet unsteady motion into the bag and you hold out a handful of injection supplies: Syringe, disinfectant, and... Whatever this blanket that Spectra procured for you here is.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia has a solemn gaze about her. Yet you feel the sheer monolithic determination to see this through as she gently grasps the items.
[]>narrator: You point to an empty spot on your thigh.
[]>one: Anything above 40 should be lethal. 60 to be sure. Above 80 and it gets unpleasant.
[]>anhedonia: I'll do 60.
[]>one: Please do.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia sets down the material and proceeds by disinfecting the injection site. Combined with the godeye tissue surrounding it, it burns like hell. No skipping of isopropyl alcohol though, you both know you'd want to do this proper.

[]>anhedonia: There we go.
[]>anhedonia: Good girl.
[]>narrator: You answer her with an assuring blink. Her display of gentleness draws a warm smile across your face. It feels warm and fuzzy inside.
[]>narrator: You are treated to a small headpat.
[]>anhedonia: Gonna draw some now.
[]>narrator: With precise and graceful movements, Anhedonia sets down the alcohol pad and picks up the vial and syringe. <mp>The vial is a lot. <ap>The syringe more than enough.
[]>one: Getting a bit dizzy... Blood loss...
[]>anhedonia: On it, Sunshine.
[]>narrator: Anhedonia stabs the vial, extracts a little more than what she needs- Then presses out any excess liquid and air with it- Down to exactly the 60 you agreed to.
[]>narrator: Syringe barrel filled with a faily yellow yet almost translucent liquid, Anhedonia rests the needle tip against your leg.

[]>anhedonia: Ready?
[]>one: ...
[]>one: Thank you... For burying me.
[]>narrator:Anhedonia affirms with a nod and a nudge against your head.
[]>one: Do it.
[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|injection3}: Not hesitating a moment longer, Anhedonia presses the needle into your skin, into your muscle. Then presses down.

[]>anhedonia: Who I am is... who I became with you... is an extension of you.
[]>one: I'm so glad I got I experience my life with you.

[]>narrator: The liquid is thick, taking a few seconds to be injected all the way, yet the warmth it exudes from the point of entry is almost immediately apparent. When Anhedonia has emptied the syringe, you share an abyssally deep gaze. She extracts the needle, sets it down, and leans in for a parting kiss. You eagerly crane forward, body already heavier than a few moments ago.
[]>narrator{one+anhedonia-emotion|injection4}: As <call:set_fade_out,0.78, 0.24>you threaten to slump, Anhedonia catches you, holds you close in her arms, a boulder to rely on.
[]>one: Hold my hand... Please...

[]>narrator: Without a shred of hesitation, yet with divine gentleness, Anhedonia moves a bit. Gives you more space to breathe, and fingers to weave together.
[]>one: I<ap>... <ap>love<ap>...
[]>one:...<call:set_fade_out,2,0.58>
[]>narrator: Speech is becoming so heavy.
[]>anhedonia: Me too. I love you so fucking much.
[]>one: Thankchu...
[]>narrator: Blackness is starting to cloud your field of vision, <call:set_fade_out,2.5,0.6>a descent into the void.
[]>narrator: You try to hold her in return as much as you can. <mp>But all the world has to offer is its unadulterated weight, draped across your mind. With a cosmic blanket, your conciousness slowly fades away. <mp>You <call:set_fade_out,3.15,0.6>slowly recede from the world as you know it, reduced to the faintest sensations around you: <ap>Anhedonia's touch, <ap>your blood dripping down your chin and your girlfriend's body, <ap>her smell, <ap>her love.
[]>narrator: <call:set_fade_out,3.8,0.73>You trust her, in eternity.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:You return to your home, your decrepit and pitiful apartment complex. <lc>Covered in dirt from the impromptu burial you conducted after One passed away, you are utterly depleted- <ap>Physically and mentally.
[]>narrator:The evening air is heavy now. <ap>Leaden. <ap>Toxic. <mp>Something to choke on.<lc>Hollowness carves into the world around you, into the toxic atmosphere that you are forced to breathe. Your lungs would not allow another perogative. <mp>You feel hollow, too. A gaping void opening up more and more as hours go by, your heart gradually consumed by a cosmic abyss.
[]>narrator:A grief to swallow all light inside you.
[]>narrator:Tonight, you never enter your bedroom. <mp>With One gone, this grove of love and togetherness has grown a glass coating. You are sure, that any fragment of your soul entering that place would shatter it in its entirety.
[]>narrator:You find comfort on the living room couch instead, where friends and strangers usually are the ones to spend their time there. <mp>These next few days will be difficult.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:The sun rises and rests, the day after lengthening to swallow you whole. <mp>This idleness does not suit you- <ap>but neither did losing One.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying2}:It was inevitable anyways.
[]>anhedonia:Fuck.
[]>anhedonia:[shake rate=20.0 level=10 connected=0]AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHUHUHHHHHHHHHH![/shake]
[]>narrator:Sleep claims you unkindly that night.

[]>narrator:...
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:...
[]>narrator:...

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:However.
[]>narrator:This limited time window you have is not to be wasted with mourning - <ap>One herself said so afterall.
[]>narrator:You cannot mess up. <mp>You cannot disappoint her. <mp>To remember her means to relish in the faith she instilled in you. <mp>You are her lover, <mp>her girlfriend, <mp>her anchor to this world. <mp>And the only other able to complete the suncalling.<lc>You do not deign to let this flame flicker out tragically without giving it your all. Over the next few days, you will follow the final instructions on suncalling preparation. <lc>That is your resolve now.<mp> That final, penultimate task, which One left you- <ap>alongside her final letter.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:On the first day, One leads you down to the river where you both went on a date once. You left the meadow with the most excruciating sunburns of your lives.
[]>narrator:The intended shrine location is a handful of paces away from the picnic spot you two picked back then, and judging by the overgrowth present here, barely anyone ever goes here still. <lc>A small, hidden sanctuary you two picked back then. <mp>Forever yours.<lc>Tinged with nostalgia, you glance at the spot as you pass, and the warm blanket of that loving memory envelops your soul.

[]>narrator:Ultimately, you reach your destination. You plant the shoebox-sized Oxylith clump on the arid soil, and drive its accompanying stakes into the ground. <mp>Secured and hidden in the grass, you write upon it its intended inscription and soak the soil in droplets of One's blood.

[]>narrator: And then- <ap>It is done.
[]>narrator:You successfully installed the shrine, all according to One's instrctions. <mp>You think she'd be proud. <mp>Maybe squeeze your hand or give you a hug.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|crying}:You could really use a hug right now.
[]>narrator:You cannot stand the sight of this work.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|sad}:And so you head back.

[]>anhedonia:...
[]>narrator:It was a nice date- Back then. You each brought snacks and used each other as pillows, exchanging kisses and bites all over each other.<mp> Eventually you even got One to submit a little and let herself get fingered out in the open. <mp>She was so fucking aroused, as were you. <ap>It was the first time you did stuff in public.<lc>Lovely memories.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>narrator:After reminiscing for a few more minutes, while you walk back up the riverbank, you can feel the pain of losing One well up in your chest once more. 
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying}:Like a spear, it pierces your sternum and convulses around your heart. <mp>Like a coiling snake, this emotion grips your heart and chokes it out- <ap>And you with it.

[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying2}:FUCK!<lc>...<lc>I'M SO SORRY...<lc>I DIDN'T MANAGE TO STAY STRONG- <ap>ALREADY.
[]>anhedonia:...
[]>anhedonia:I just... Want to hold you again...
[]>narrator:And the wind carries those desires with it, never to be reciprocated again.

[]>anhedonia: Why is loss so fucking... <ap>Gods.
[]>anhedonia: This fucking heartbreak.
[]>narrator: Sobbing and slowly stumbling across the shoreline, you make you way back up the main road. So far you are on track for your final duty. You would visit One's grave later to pick it off from nesting parasites, which left you with a few hours to kill.

[]>narrator: You kill said hours with more wanderings. Delirious and dissociated, you eventually find yourself in front of another shrine. One built this one weeks ago. <lc>You struggle to remember when that was exactly, or what is inscribed here. You cannot read the script that One used in this one for sure.
[]>narrator:Almost as if by intent- <ap>Probably so in fact- <ap>One never talked about the shrines after installing them. They were done, had been perfected and erected exactly where they needed to be. And as such, they were immediately to be discarded. They were done. Onto the next project.
[]>narrator: She was relentless. You loved that about her. Still do.
[]>narrator: Gods, you still love her.

[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|neutral}:With an intermittent stop at the shallow grave you pick off any errant critters. <mp>When you return home, it becomes apparent that this nightfall will be no less gentle than the last one.
[]>narrator:The emptiness clawing at your chest runs deep, chores keep piling up, tchotchkes lining the apartment in nooks you never noticed, bitter reminders of your darling's passing.
[]>narrator:Its edges try to rend your heart to bits and there is no one else to soften the assault. <mp>Under choked tears, you hold your own hand to your chest, above your beating heart.
[]>narrator{anhedonia-emotion|crying}:It hurts.
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying2}:[shake rate=20.0 level=15 connected=1]ONE PLEASE I FUCKING HATE THIS SO MUCH!!![/shake]
[]>anhedonia{anhedonia-emotion|crying}:I'm sorry.
[]>narrator:The sun is coming up again.<lc>Your attempt to sleep this wave of grief away again.

[]>narrator:And with the sun somewhere in the sky, you find yourself awake again.
[]>narrator:The days stretch out before you and retract in their myopic scope again. <mp>Already it has become nigh impossible for you to tell how many hours you have lost to grief, how many trips you have taken up the hill to pluck away any bugs, or how many times you have had to wake up without One next to you. <mp>Your rugged inner turmoil has not even allowed you to sleep entire nights. <mp>Sometimes you sleep, sometimes you wake. <mp>What does it matter anyways?
[]>narrator:The world probably has moved on- Outside your window. But who are you to care for it?
[]>narrator: When you try focus you can almost achieve practice. With the typewritten poem in front of you, you study it every moment you find the waves washing over your heart bearable enough to do so.
[]>narrator: By now, a message rests in the telegram receptacle. It has been there for some hours before you eventually mount the courage to glance a peek. The sender lessens your tension, if just a bit. <lc>Spectra.
[]>spectra{spectra-emotion|invisible}:Isolation will kill you before the sun does. Call me. I will be there.

[]>narrator:Kneeling before the most holy sight, you slowly place your palms on the opening in One's abdominal wall. <mp>And then you press- Press your fingers knuckle by knuckle<call:set_emotion,one+anhedonia,dismemberment4>, then your hands, and then your forearms deep down into her hollowed abdomen. <lc>The unabated sound of squelching and churning organs fills the corpse-juice filled air around you and then your fingertips make contact. <mp>Contact, with her spine. <lc>You glide your fingers up and down, feeling all those tendons and muscles that once held her upright and made her voice emenate. <lc>This organic machinery that gave you so much love and begged for ever more mutilation has reached its end state. <mp>An end state for one singular purpose: <ap>Your ring finger touches it first. <mp>A glowingly warm presence- <ap>A granite boulder and obsidian dagger in one. <lc>Upon touching the godseed, your heart begins to quiet. Replaced with it is the deafening noise of the sun, screaming for the opportunity to grow into the celestial being it was cultivated to become.
